title: Thunderbird - New? User!
content:
I am in a bit of a mess so I am hoping that someone might be able to sort me out......and to clear my conscience, I made a small contribution to Thunderbird recently! Ever since Microsoft had "Windows Live Mail" I have been using it and VERY successfully until Optusnet were having difficulties with it communicating with 'any one'. So recentIy I changed my email address from <gnwalton@optusnet,com.au> to <gnwalton58@gmail.com> and had Gmail read my optusnet account as another account to read.

Optus are my "carrier" (my access to the internet) and have been ever since their inception many years ago.

1. Please look at Image 1 screen dump: You can see from this that I have had various spasmodic entrances into Thunderbird, which I would now like to erase. How?

2. Windows Live Mail had a feature where, while I believed it was downloading my INbox and SENT files from the Optus server or Internet, it also automatically saved these files to my own computer hard drive. I was therefore able to attach a past file (perhaps years ago) to a current email as an attachment........without any archiving! I have instructed Thunderbird to POP my files - which I believe is not allowing them to reside in the "cloud" - so that they now reside IN Thunderbird ON my computer? Could you please confirm my beliefs, or otherwise?

3. Perhaps all this info is contained somewhere is a separate file so I would appreciate your referral to such info and make life easy for you.

4. Perhaps I should also explain I am a retired octogenarian chemical engineer who has been interested in and solving process problems all my life!! I'm just naturally curious!

Kind regards, Geoff Walton Melbourne, Australia
creator: gnwalton58

title: Addressbook empty
content: Hello, I recently got a new computer - the ninth or twelvth (i've been programmer and service techy all my working life, processing over 5000 comps over time - big company), so I have always transferred the right profile contents to the new profile in the roaming folder - everytime all was working fine. Now, with Thunderbird version 137.0.1 (64-Bit) in Win 10 pro I have the problem that although copying the files to the right place again (roaming) the addressbooks stayed empty, but all the old mail structures and mails came nicely over in the new system. Manually copying the abook.mab (100KB) and history.mab (50KB) to the roaming profiles has absolutely no effect, the addressbooks stay empty stubbornly. I have deleted and uninstalled Thunderbird, deleted the Roamings and Locals to make a clean new install with re-copying to the profile files - no effect either. Ten minutes ago while looking for the version a new update rolled in, so I restarted, to no avail - still empty addressbooks. I could always print these files and manually rewrite the 3 abooks, but this should be the last remedy only. Any ideas what is running wrong? A BIG THANKS for your help! Peter
creator: peter2uat

title: Mailing lists - 'must contain a domain'
content:
TB Portable 137.0.1 Windows 11 24H2

I've created a mailing list in my personal address book, typed in the names as they auto filled from my current address book, and saved the list.,

If I right click on the mailing list in the address book and select write, it sends OK.

However when I forward an email and selecting the list to send to, I get the following error.

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded <mailing list>: recipient address must contain a domain. Please check the message recipient "mailing list" and try again.

The To field has the following mailing list <mailing list>

It appears that TB is using the name of the mailing list as the recipient instead of using the email addresses in the mailing list.


I have another TB portable install that works as expected. ie I can start typing the mailing list name in the To (or CC & BCC) fields and it sends OK.

title: How to Re-Download an E-Mail ?
content:
Hello again.

I asked this before but still it's not working.

Sometimes E-Mails shown in Thunderbird are missing 50% of the content (first 50%). Today 2 E-Mails got mixed up. So Thunderbird showed 2 E-Mails with the same content but different Subjects. So 1 was wrong. When I logged into my E-Mail Account then it was all ok there. So it must be a Thunderbird Problem or Server-IMAP Problem.

The Question is: How can I tell Thunderbird to re-download this email ?

I was told here this before: "right click the folder, select properties and then the repair button. Does that fix it?" Yes that does solve it but this mixes up the view in Thunderbird (columns are resetted), I don't want that.

Is there any way to re-download a specific email ? I really wonder why such a professionel e-mail program lacks such simple function.

Thank you Nico

title: Synchonizing issue with Exchange/Apple Mail and Thunderbird
content:
Hello everybody

Lastly my e-mail provider (DomainFactory) switched to Microsoft exchange so that I had to adapt all my Mail Programs.

Apparently an update of existing Mail accounts on my devices is not possible so I had to add new accounts.

First problem I have now is that IMAP does not seem to work in Thunderbird. I added a new account with all the necessary settings. But now I always get a message popup that does not even gives me a full description. The text I see is: "User is authenticated but n..."

Then I tried Owl. That now works, but I would rather use just IMAP.


Also another problem. On my IPhone I also added a new account in the standard Apple Mail programm. There it worked. But when I read a Mail on my phone it does not synchronize anymore with Thunderbird. I can see the Mail in the browser version of Outlook. So I wonder why Thunderbird does not synchonize read e-mails that still are on the server....

title: Archive Folder Not Displayed, No Message Found After Folder Repair
content:
Hello, I'm running Thunderbird 137.0.1 on Win 10 64 bit pc. I'm having some issues with Thunderbird and need some help. I'm not sure if I have 1 profile or 2 as I restored old messages from a pre windows re instillation a few weeks ago, i followed the directions from Mozilla's support article. Today I went to compact folder on my main e-mail account and received error that the folder can't be compacted because it contains unexpected data. I then used the repair folder and when Thunderbird restarted, my inbox message are all gone, about 20 of them. If i do a search in Thunderbird for a known e-mail message, the search screen shows the e-mail message subject line and when I click on it, the new tab will display no message found.

Before this happened I did not see the archive folder in the folder pane, but did not think anything about it until now. I was thinking the messages that are no longer in my inbox would be in the archive folder without being able to show or find the archive folder hoping it may hold the messages.

Is it possible the messages are somewhere on my PC and can be recovered? If so what is the best way to accomplish this? In addition how do i get the archive folders to show up on my e-mail accounts. If this is not the correct forum, please let me know so I can correct this!

Thanks! MM
